show_thumbnail.description: Show or hide content fields without the need to delete the content itself.
show_thumbnail.text: Show the navigation thumbnail instead of the image

grid_masonry.label: Masonry
grid_masonry.description: Create a gap-free layout if grid items have different heights.

grid_parallax.label: Parallax
grid_parallax.description: The parallax effect moves single grid columns at different speeds while scrolling. Define the vertical parallax offset in pixels.

grid_column_gap.label: Column Gap
grid_column_gap.description: Set the size of the gap between the grid columns.

grid_row_gap.label: Row Gap
grid_row_gap.description: Set the size of the gap between the grid rows.

grid_divider.label: Divider
grid_divider.description: Show a divider between grid columns.

grid_row_align.description: Center grid columns horizontally and rows vertically.

grid_default.label: Phone Portrait
grid_default.description: Set the number of grid columns for each breakpoint. Inherit refers to the number of columns on the next smaller screen size. Auto expands the columns to the width of their items filling the rows accordingly.

grid_small.label: Phone Landscape
grid_small.description: Set the number of grid columns for each breakpoint. Inherit refers to the number of columns on the next smaller screen size. Auto expands the columns to the width of their items filling the rows accordingly.

grid_medium.label: Tablet Landscape
grid_medium.description: Set the number of grid columns for each breakpoint. Inherit refers to the number of columns on the next smaller screen size. Auto expands the columns to the width of their items filling the rows accordingly.

grid_large.label: Desktop
grid_large.description: Set the number of grid columns for each breakpoint. Inherit refers to the number of columns on the next smaller screen size. Auto expands the columns to the width of their items filling the rows accordingly.

grid_xlarge.label: Large Screens
grid_xlarge.description: Set the number of grid columns for each breakpoint. Inherit refers to the number of columns on the next smaller screen size. Auto expands the columns to the width of their items filling the rows accordingly.

filter_animation.label: Animation
filter_animation.description: Select an animation that will be applied to the content items when filtering between them.

filter_style.label: Style
filter_style.description: Select the filter navigation style. The pill and divider styles are only available for horizontal Subnavs.

filter_all.label: All Items
filter_all.text: Show filter control for all items

filter_position.label: Position
filter_position.description: Position the filter navigation at the top, left or right. A larger style can be applied to left and right navigation.

filter_grid_width.label: Grid Width
filter_grid_width.description: Define the width of the filter navigation. Choose between percent and fixed widths or expand columns to the width of their content.

filter_grid_column_gap.label: Grid Column Gap
filter_grid_column_gap.description: Set the size of the gap between between the filter navigation and the content.

filter_grid_row_gap.label: Grid Row Gap
filter_grid_row_gap.description: Set the size of the gap if the grid items stack.

filter_grid_breakpoint.label: Grid Breakpoint
filter_grid_breakpoint.description: Set the breakpoint from which grid items will stack.

panel_style.label: Style
panel_style.description: Select one of the boxed card or tile styles or a blank panel.

panel_image_no_padding.description: Top, left or right aligned images can be attached to the panel edge. If the image is aligned to the left or right, it will also extend to cover the whole space.

panel_content_width.label: 1 Column Content Width
panel_content_width.description: Set an optional content width which doesn't affect the image if there is just one column.
panel_content_width.enable: show_image && image_align == 'top' && !panel_padding && !item_maxwidth && (!grid_default || grid_default == '1') && (!grid_small || grid_small == '1') && (!grid_medium || grid_medium == '1') && (!grid_large || grid_large == '1') && (!grid_xlarge || grid_xlarge == '1')

panel_expand.label: Expand Content
panel_expand.description: Expand the height of the content to fill the available space in the panel and push the link to the bottom.

title_style.label: Style
title_style.description: Title styles differ in font-size but may also come with a predefined color, size and font.

title_link.label: Link
title_link.description: Link the title if a link exists.

title_hover_style.label: Hover Style
title_hover_style.description: Set the hover style for a linked title.

title_decoration.label: Decoration
title_decoration.description: Decorate the title with a divider, bullet or a line that is vertically centered to the heading.

title_font_family.label: Font Family
title_font_family.description: Select an alternative font family. Mind that not all styles have different font families.

title_color.label: Color
title_color.description: Select the text color. If the Background option is selected, styles that don't apply a background image use the primary color instead.

title_element.label: HTML Element
title_element.description: Set the level for the section heading or give it no semantic meaning.

title_align.label: Alignment
title_align.description: Align the title to the top or left in regards to the content.

title_grid_width.label: Grid Width
title_grid_width.description: Define the width of the title within the grid. Choose between percent and fixed widths or expand columns to the width of their content.

title_grid_column_gap.label: Grid Column Gap
title_grid_column_gap.description: Set the size of the gap between the title and the content.

title_grid_row_gap.label: Grid Row Gap
title_grid_row_gap.description: Set the size of the gap if the grid items stack.

title_grid_breakpoint.label: Grid Breakpoint
title_grid_breakpoint.description: Set the breakpoint from which grid items will stack.

title_margin.label: Margin Top
title_margin.description: Set the top margin. Note that the margin will only apply if the content field immediately follows another content field.

meta_style.label: Style
meta_style.description: Select a predefined meta text style, including color, size and font-family.

meta_element.label: HTML Element
meta_element.description: Set the level for the section heading or give it no semantic meaning.

meta_margin.label: Margin Top
meta_margin.description: Set the top margin. Note that the margin will only apply if the content field immediately follows another content field.

content_style.label: Style
content_style.description: Select a predefined text style, including color, size and font-family.

content_dropcap.label: Drop Cap
content_dropcap.description: Display the first letter of the paragraph as a large initial.

content_column.label: Columns
content_column.description: Set the number of text columns.

content_column_divider.description: Show a divider between text columns.

content_column_breakpoint.label: Columns Breakpoint
content_column_breakpoint.description: Set the device width from which the text columns should apply.

content_margin.label: Margin Top
content_margin.description: Set the top margin. Note that the margin will only apply if the content field immediately follows another content field.

image_loading.label: Loading
image_loading.description: By default, images are loaded lazy. Enable eager loading for images in the initial viewport.

image_box_shadow.label: Box Shadow
image_box_shadow.description: Select the image box shadow size.

image_align.label: Alignment
image_align.description: Align the image to the top, left, right or place it between the title and the content.

image_grid_width.label: Grid Width
image_grid_width.description: Define the width of the image within the grid. Choose between percent and fixed widths or expand columns to the width of their content.

image_grid_column_gap.label: Grid Column Gap
image_grid_column_gap.description: Set the size of the gap between the image and the content.

image_grid_row_gap.label: Grid Row Gap
image_grid_row_gap.description: Set the size of the gap if the grid items stack.

image_grid_breakpoint.label: Grid Breakpoint
image_grid_breakpoint.description: Set the breakpoint from which grid items will stack.

image_margin.label: Margin Top
image_margin.description: Set the top margin. Note that the margin will only apply if the content field immediately follows another content field.

slideshow_ratio.label: Ratio
slideshow_ratio.description: Set the slideshow ratio. It's recommended to use the same ratio as the image or video file. Simply use its width and height, e.g. 1600:900.

slideshow_min_height.label: Min Height
slideshow_min_height.description: Use an optional minimum height to prevent the slideshow from becoming smaller than its content on small devices.

text_color.label: Text Color
text_color.description: Set light or dark color mode for controls.

slideshow_animation.label: Transition
slideshow_animation.description: Select the transition between two slides.

slideshow_velocity.label: Velocity
slideshow_velocity.description: Set the velocity in pixels per millisecond.

slideshow_autoplay_interval.label: Interval
slideshow_autoplay_interval.description: Set the autoplay interval in seconds.

slideshow_kenburns.label: Ken Burns Effect
slideshow_kenburns.description: Select the transformation origin for the Ken Burns animation.

slideshow_kenburns_duration.label: Duration
slideshow_kenburns_duration.description: Set the duration for the Ken Burns effect in seconds.

nav_position.label: Position
nav_position.description: Select the position of the navigation.

nav_position_margin.label: Margin
nav_position_margin.description: Apply a margin between the navigation and the slideshow container.

nav_breakpoint.label: Breakpoint
nav_breakpoint.description: Display the navigation only on this device width and larger.

nav_color.label: Color
nav_color.description: Set light or dark color if the navigation is below the slideshow.

thumbnav_nowrap.label: Thumbnav Wrap
thumbnav_nowrap.description: Define whether thumbnails wrap into multiple lines if the container is too small.

thumbnav_svg_inline.label: Thumbnav Inline SVG
thumbnav_svg_inline.description: Inject SVG images into the page markup so that they can easily be styled with CSS.

thumbnav_svg_color.label: Thumbnav SVG Color
thumbnav_svg_color.description: Select the SVG color. It will only apply to supported elements defined in the SVG.

slidenav.label: Position
slidenav.description: Select the position of the slidenav.

slidenav_margin.label: Margin
slidenav_margin.description: Apply a margin between the slidenav and the slideshow container.

slidenav_breakpoint.label: Breakpoint
slidenav_breakpoint.description: Display the slidenav only on this device width and larger.

slidenav_outside_breakpoint.label: Outside Breakpoint
slidenav_outside_breakpoint.description: Display the slidenav outside only on this device width and larger. Otherwise, display it inside.

slidenav_outside_color.label: Outside Color
slidenav_outside_color.description: Set light or dark color if the slidenav is outside.

link_text.label: Text
link_text.description: Enter the text for the link.

link_aria_label.label: ARIA Label
link_aria_label.description: Enter a descriptive text label to make it accessible if the link has no visible text.

link_margin.label: Margin Top
link_margin.description: Set the top margin. Note that the margin will only apply if the content field immediately follows another content field.

css.label: CSS
css.description: Enter your own custom CSS. The following selectors will be prefixed automatically for this element: .el-element, .el-item, .el-title, .el-meta, .el-content, .el-image, .el-link

fields.label: Thumbnail Width/Height
fields.description: Setting just one value preserves the original proportions. The image will be resized and cropped automatically, and where possible, high resolution images will be auto-generated.

fields.label: Width/Height
fields.description: Setting just one value preserves the original proportions. The image will be resized and cropped automatically, and where possible, high resolution images will be auto-generated.
